definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Dolores, please come in and countersign a cheque.
sentences.chinese: 多洛雷斯，请进来连署支票。

sentences.english: Mr. Fish invited the crab and his daughter into his cozy office.
sentences.chinese: 鱼先生把蟹和他女儿请进他舒适的办公室。

sentences.english: Drop in tonight after word, if you can.
sentences.chinese: 如有可能，今晚下班后请进来坐坐。

sentences.english: S: Please come in and feel free to take a look around the house.
Mr. Cohen, please come in and take a look at the full Kowloon Park view.
sentences.chinese: 商汉教授，请进来随便看看，这是九龙公园全景。

sentences.english: A: Mr. Cohen, please come in and take a look at the full Know Loon Park view.
sentences.chinese: 高汉先生，请进来随便看看，这是九龙公园全景。

sentences.english: When a servant opened the door, I asked for Mr Appleton and was shown in.
sentences.chinese: 仆人开了门，我求见阿普尔顿先生，于是被请进去。

sentences.english: Hi, come on in. I'm Catherine, the listing agent.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，请进我是凯瑟琳，仲介商。

sentences.english: Welcome to my home . Come in and , please .
sentences.chinese: 欢迎来到我的家，请进来，坐下。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, please go in and sign up.
sentences.chinese: 尽管这样，请进来并签到。

sentences.english: Welcome to our devildom. Come in, please.
A: Mr.Cohen, please come in and take a look at the full Kowloon Park view.
sentences.chinese: 商汉先生，请进来随便看看，这是九龙公园全景。

sentences.english: Fish. Mr. Fish invited the crab and his daughter into his cozy office.
sentences.chinese: 鱼先生把蟹和他女儿请进他舒适的办公室。

definition: (said by departing guest) no need to see me out
we are honored by your presence
to look forward to sth/to wait respectfully
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to request the pleasure of seeing sb/to ask sb in/to ask sb to do sth (e.g. make a speech)
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
same as 慢慢吃[man4 man4 chi1]
